items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details: This "Study Session" was scheduled at the direct request of the Board of Trustees.  The Board requested the Chancellor to extend an invitation to Dr. Barbara Beno, President, Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges and William McGinnis, Trustee, Butte-Glenn Community College District.  Specifically, Dr. Beno and Trustee McGinnis were asked to provide expert advice in responding to the "Shared Recommendations" regarding governance resulting from the Accreditation Site Visit to both San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College on October 18-21, 2010.  In particular, the Trustees expressed their desire and commitment to have a better understanding about expected behavior and the type of evidence that would best respond to the Commissions' concerns regarding effective governance. The Trustees expressed interest in gaining greater understanding and awareness about governance standards and performance measures from Trustee McGinnis and his perspective as a "practicing trustee."  It is expected that the study session will demonstrate the Board's commitment to effective governance as well as their deep interest in responding to the Commission's findings.
